openData.subheader: Our collected data are open to everyone

about.title: About
about.headWho: We are a team of developers
about.who: We want to help to evaluate the current situation of the COVID-19 pandemic in every country that need it. This project is developed by a team of Switzerland developers and they open sourced the code to the world to help other countries. Now, it is maintained by an intenational team to bring this to every countries that need it. The aim is to deliver the community driven data collection to the public. This information provides the current situation of the COVID-19 pandemia.
about.needYou: Our app is based on your self-reporting. That means only if you provide data, this app can show more real data about your area. So it is important that all of you provide your health data and then update your health status if it changed during the course of lockdown.
about.headData: We donâ€™t save any personal information in our servers!
about.data: Every data is anonymous but to keep our datasets consistent, we need that you always use the same browser to update your status (otherwise you will be counted twice). This information is NOT OFFICIAL and is based on direct voluntary reports from the population. We trust that you will honestly report your health status, to generate the most accurate visualization possible.
about.dataUpdate: Currently, it is not supported. If we get enough support, we will bring this feature to you. We will provide update of the numbers as frequently as we can.
about.headPublicData: Want to use our data or join us?
about.publicData: Our dataset is public and open in our github. Please use it to make your own awesome visualization, or join our effort to open up in other countries
about.dataCare: Keep in mind that our dataset is based on self-reporting from peoples thus the data are not official and could contains errors. The data is only intended to be used as an indicator.
about.improvement: For improvements or if you want to report an error, please contact us on Facebook or Github.
